newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian Lensvyaz telecom stake may be tendered.
newsitem.headline: Russian Lensvyaz telecom stake may be tendered.

text.p: A 22 percent stake in telecom AO Lensvyaz may be put up for auction, regional privatisation officials said on Tuesday, charging the winner of a previous tender with failing to meet investment commitments.

"If we can find an investor ready to invest $40 million, the shares will be put up for a second auction," said Yelena Sergeyeva, deputy chairwoman of the Leningrad region property fund, a regional government body responsible for privatisation.

Irina Tokareva, a specialist for the property fund, said it had annulled an agreement with IFK Romeks-Invest, the registered owner of the shares, because Romeks had failed to meet the terms of a tender it won in October 1995.
Romeks-Invest officials were unavailable for comment and Lensvyaz officials declined to comment.
Tokareva said Romeks had invested only $8.0 million of a required $14.8 million in Lensvyaz as of last December 9. Altogether, Romeks is required to invest $40 million over three years.
She said that when the investor does not meet tender conditions "the shares return to the fund and the enterprise keeps the invested monies."

OAO Svyazinvest owns 51 percent of voting shares of Lensvyaz, which is listed on the RTS-2 shares system. Romeks owns 29 percent of voting shares (22 percent of equity) and OOO Titul owns 10 percent of voting shares.
